title: Rolland E. Kidder
text:
Rolland E. Kidder is an American politician and author from <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York State</a>.
Born in <a href="Jamestown%2C%20New%20York">Jamestown, New York</a>, Kidder served in the <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> during the <a href="Vietnam%20War">Vietnam War</a>. Kidder graduated from <a href="Houghton%20College">Houghton College</a> and <a href="SUNY%20Buffalo%20Law%20School">SUNY Buffalo Law School</a>. He later served on the <a href="American%20Battle%20Monuments%20Commission">American Battle Monuments Commission</a> and the <a href="National%20World%20War%20II%20Memorial">National World War II Memorial</a> Design Committee.
A <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democrat</a>, Kidder served four terms in the <a href="New%20York%20State%20Assembly">New York State Assembly</a>, serving in the <a href="181st%20New%20York%20State%20Legislature">181st</a>, <a href="182nd%20New%20York%20State%20Legislature">182nd</a>, <a href="183rd%20New%20York%20State%20Legislature">183rd</a>, and <a href="184th%20New%20York%20State%20Legislature">184th</a> New York State Legislatures from January 8, 1975 to December 31, 1982.
